2026-01-28.content:
Datastream now supports Spanner as a source. For more
information, see the
[Datastream documentation](https://docs.cloud.google.com/datastream/docs/sources-spanner).

summary.title: Datastream now supports Spanner
summary.summary: Datastream has added support for Spanner as a data source. This integration allows for seamless data replication from Spanner into other destinations. For more details, please refer to the Datastream documentation.

2025-11-17.content: Datastream now supports partitioning and clustering for BigQuery destinations. For more information, see [the documentation](https://docs.cloud.google.com/datastream/docs/partitioning-and-clustering).

summary.title: Datastream BigQuery Integration
summary.summary: Datastream now supports partitioning and clustering for BigQuery destinations.

2025-09-30.content: Datastream support for Salesforce as a source is now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages). For more information, see [the documentation](https://cloud.google.com/datastream/docs/sources-salesforce).

summary.title: Datastream for Salesforce
summary.summary: Datastream now supports Salesforce as a source, and it is generally available.

2025-09-23.content: Datastream support for MongoDB as a source is now [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages). For more information, see [the documentation](https://cloud.google.com/datastream/docs/sources-mongodb).

summary.title: Datastream MongoDB Source Now Available
summary.summary: Datastream now supports MongoDB as a source, which is now generally available.

2025-06-30.content: Datastream is now available in the `northamerica-south1` (Mexico) region. For the list of all available regions, see [IP allowlists and regions](https://cloud.google.com/datastream/docs/ip-allowlists-and-regions).

summary.title: Datastream now available in Mexico
summary.summary: Datastream is now available in Mexico (northamerica-south1). For more details, refer to the IP allowlists and regions documentation.

2025-06-23.content:
Datastream now supports BigLake Iceberg tables as a destination both in the
Google Cloud console and the Datastream API.

For more information, see the [Datastream documentation](https://cloud.google.com/datastream/docs/destination-blmt).

summary.title: Datastream supports BigLake Iceberg tables
summary.summary: Datastream now supports BigLake Iceberg tables as a destination, accessible via the Google Cloud console and the Datastream API.
